validationRules.templates: Required when contentSource='template', must be valid template slug
validationRules.contentMaxHeight: Required, initial collapsed height (0 = fully collapsed)

warnings: contentMaxHeight of 0 will fully collapse content (useful for FAQs)
customOpacity requires opacityColor to be set for gradient fade effect
opacityHeight controls the height of the gradient fade (default 60-80px recommended)
Template mode requires valid template slug from Saved Templates
extraButton requires extraButtonText and extraButtonLink.url to be set
iconPosition affects icon offset attributes (before vs after)
transDuration is in milliseconds (200-500ms recommended for smooth transitions)
ariaLabel improves accessibility for screen readers (highly recommended)
Always set openTypography: 1 before setting typography values
Don't set contentMaxHeight too small on mobile (xs breakpoint)
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set customOpacity: true when using opacityColor
Setting templates but leaving contentSource as 'customContent'
Using template slugs that don't exist in WordPress
Not setting contentMaxHeight (defaults to 100px, may not match content)
Setting extraButton: true but forgetting extraButtonLink.url
Not testing collapsed height on different breakpoints (md/sm/xs)
Using very large transDuration (makes UX feel sluggish)
Forgetting readMoreIcon and collapseIcon (defaults to angle icons)
Setting typography attributes without openTypography: 1 first
Not accounting for gradient overlay height in contentMaxHeight
bestPractices: Set contentMaxHeight to show 2-3 lines of content initially
Use customOpacity: true with gradient fade for better visual UX
Set opacityHeight to 60-80px for smooth gradient transition
Use meaningful toggle text ('Read Full Article' vs 'Read More')
Add icons to toggle buttons for visual clarity
Set transDuration to 300-400ms for smooth but fast transitions
Center-align toggle buttons for symmetric layouts
Use extraButton for secondary CTAs (Contact, Learn More, etc.)
Add ariaLabel for screen reader accessibility
Use titleTag semantically (h2 for main headings, h3 for subheadings)
Apply box shadows to toggle buttons for depth
Use gradient backgrounds for modern, premium look
Test with long and short content to ensure proper behavior
Keep toggle button text concise (2-4 words max)

customContent.whenToUse: Simple content, unique one-time content, inline text

template.description: Load content from WordPress Saved Template
template.whenToUse: Complex layouts, reusable content, Pro feature requirement
warnings: Template must exist in Nexter > Saved Templates
Template slug must be exact match

before.useCase: Plus/minus icons, quote icons, directional icons pointing right

after.useCase: Down/up arrows, chevrons, default Western (LTR) reading order

accessibilityNotes: Always set ariaLabel for main toggle button (describes what will happen)
Set ariaLabelEb for extra button if using extraButton: true
Ensure color contrast meets WCAG AA standards (4.5:1 minimum)
Toggle button should be keyboard accessible (Tab to focus, Enter/Space to toggle)
Use semantic HTML in title (h2, h3, etc. not div when possible)
Icons should supplement text, not replace it
Collapsed content should still be accessible to screen readers
Use meaningful toggle text that describes the action
